intro: Polycarpaea synandra var. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
